topic.title: Distributed Gaming
topic.body: Anyone know of any games playable on ZeroNet?

topic.title: Dropbox for ZeroNet
topic.body: Is there a solution for ZeroNet that is similar to Dropbox?

1_1d6oFadKcBXxEZHvmvAiZCoyrBeAmmLdi.body:
> [nulldist](#comment_2_1ERuwreHChh4jfsTo7rUJhD3G9qaKf2nL7): would very much like to see some different things here

Like what?
No specific recommendation for documentaries. Milk was okay. An example of a more contemporary, feel good exploration could be The Way He Looks.
No specific recommendation for documentaries. Milk was okay. An example of a more contemporary, feel good exploration could be The Way He Looks.

> [kekpharaoh](#comment_2_195JPVPMW7foR7zr4tRi6zTssehDNMGqdi): Homos

Litterally says it in the title. Keep up, buddy.

3_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY.body:
> [akito](#comment_94_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): Has the same problem as every other generic torrent.... It mostly features discographies and single artists. I need a huge compilation of random crap because it wouldn't only be a waste of time but also effort to find all the different artists separately and then open like 5000 torrents at once since they are only like 300MB each.

Ah. Not sure then. Starting a DJ business? You could very likely script out the acquisition and dedupe [via hash or string comparison]. Torrents should have a manifest for the latter.

> [akito](#comment_97_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): Don't know how to do that.

If you dont have a solve by the weekend, I may be able to knock something out. Otherwise, it is a great day to learn Python.

1_14mEkwhDkggFR82vyiFx3QdSLJRKVwMg41.body: Are you selling time or hardware?

1_1M78zG4cdm2osFEpXApCHxh6bu936kgte6.body: I love it. Thanks. Anyone else?

> [m0ckingb3ard](#comment_4_1HGr5q2yEov55cZf7NE5qBkJvTVSJZVM6g): You mean a game that requires stable connection?

Potentially, where the normally centralized server component could be spread around multiple peers and the client can propogate nominally.

> [m0ckingb3ard](#comment_4_1HGr5q2yEov55cZf7NE5qBkJvTVSJZVM6g): You mean a game that requires stable connection?

To answer your question: not necessarily.

> [m0ckingb3ard](#comment_5_1HGr5q2yEov55cZf7NE5qBkJvTVSJZVM6g): A Flappy Bird game would definately work. I was thinking more of a online game where ping matters.

There would have to be some serious advanced cacheing, but wouldnt be... impossible.
Tl;dr: single player browser games and turn-based games would be immediately feasible. Other options arent appropriate.

13529_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body: Decentralizing services and commerce is the ultimate goal. Its when subversion becomes useful does capitalism prey on it.

2_123rY6a7W3RMmgFHrTdMR1NwGfciuKwsV4.body: Something that reflects your exposed IP back to you?

1_1K94YiuAXaLsup6mn1FPMCxZanFt7CBjAT.body: Python for prototyping. Go for micro services. Java for larger projects. C for embedded.

Welcome them to the new world. :)

I soeak practically no Chinese. Lets help each other.

6_17VwZEfWSUWb5RHkK9m1odnDdBfvjTL6Cp.body: Negative freedom on PC. OSX. The form factor is married to the OS so well it is hard to use something else. I have tried. Next machine will be something with less vendor lock-in. Something like Razer. Thoughts?

2_1KWWKVJPZoHdMLWBSmLJZVrVZJmLxkxwee.body: I will fight blockchain until my last or until it changes. It is not sustainable.

4_1Jk6iv2QXUgZo4Y4P5ZUKe7SrpMnGs5unL.body:
> [nofish](#comment_971_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): It's really sad realizing the loss of the culture when a community powered site goes down. Also eye-opening as it could happen to any site when it became financially unprofitable.Btw. can anyone explain to me why would operating a site like SoundCloud requires 420 people?

Guessing they wanted to build out additonal products, but due to some internal or external forces failed. 

It probably wouldnt be terribly difficult to build a music player or wrapper for Zeronet with external pointers. The amount of data might be prohibitive. Could be mistaken. Still noodling on it

> [hook54321](#comment_5_1Jk6iv2QXUgZo4Y4P5ZUKe7SrpMnGs5unL): Wouldn't people have to download all of it if they want to view it though?

In the current landscape, they would have to, at minimum, download what they wanted to listen to.

1_18C45ndJpnDbtgU7QdFxbfcENxBsPPEUtG.body:
> [planespherev3](#comment_208_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): Left wing and right wing doesn't mean shit.  [...]

Seconded. The ideas of free market and taxation are mutually exclusive.

2_1M78zG4cdm2osFEpXApCHxh6bu936kgte6.body: Do we have a GitHub hosted in ZeroNet? I will probably look at moving the whole build pipeline into ZeroNet and go from there. So much fun research to do!

3_1M78zG4cdm2osFEpXApCHxh6bu936kgte6.body: ZeroNet, as with all things, is useless if not used. People expressing ideas isnt something that should be stifled. Questioned, critisized, called out? Yes. Oppressed by governments ir corporations? No.

> [rubit](#comment_5_18sV4LF2Q372BLkTJN5Z24HeRexQQscx1E): @eelelo that's why you should spread the word about it ;)

That os precisely why I spread the word. ZeroNet is not a coddling place but an outlet for unbridled nature of what the Internet should be. Free thought, free development, free humanity. 

Civility is still law.

1_1Bk2heJQnpwHvQLSt5s4PZc9pdjH6MtqHE.body:
> [james007](#comment_5_1DiRWRFXcVgQQ75cXnAG2pyxxjGo2VaH5): Excellent idea. Looks like someone is already on it

Yess.  The biggest issue is the apparent lack of server support. I am still investigating, but Id love to have collab.

> [ivanq](#comment_29_1CvyxRucf7BbDvGtFe5LayTS2qX88VN7Er): Yes, we can. I even know how. But too much time will be needed to do this alone.

What are you thinking?
